# oatmeal

`oatmeal` helps survey researchers quickly wrangle their data.

## Installation

You can install the development version of oatmeal from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("jjmoncus/oatmeal")
```

## Usage

See forthcoming vignettes, or contact J.J. Moncus at
<jjmoncus706@gmail.com> with questions

# Package index

## All functions

- [`find_batts()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/oatmeal/reference/find_batts.md)
  : Make educated guesses for which variables pertain to the same
  battery
- [`find_ids()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/oatmeal/reference/find_ids.md)
  : Find variables which could be the unique ID
- [`find_label()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/oatmeal/reference/find_label.md)
  : Find variable labels that match a given string
- [`find_level()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/oatmeal/reference/find_level.md)
  : Find variables with any level that match a pattern
- [`meta()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/oatmeal/reference/meta.md) :
  Create a metadata file for a dataset
